channel.title: PostScript Viewer [C++/OpenGL]
channel.description:
I had to do this for a project due tomorrow, figured it may be of use to someone for learning C++ and/or OpenGL. The archive contains the whole project, all you need to compile it is a C++ compiler and the GLU/GLUT/OpenGL libraries, compile it with the '-lglut' linker options. If you have problems post here.
I have included sample .ps files in the /src/ folder. Try the +, -, and arrow keys.
I am uploading one built executable, it is probably only x64, try it under a 32-bit enviroment and see what happens, I may cross-build a windows executable later if I feel like it.
Note this is real C++, not some bastardized windows version.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/psviewerLinuxx64 http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/psviewer.zip
edit: build for you win32 whores out there: http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/psviewer.exe

item.title: PostScript Viewer [C++/OpenGL]
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Yeah, if you have a cheap PC, that actually increases your chances of finding a working distro. It’s the lag of the OS community in being compatible with new hardware that is the main problem.

seand:

works fine for me under winxp sp2

I didn’t actually try to compile (I don’t have OpenGL libs on this pc). I’m sure his build he updated the thread with will work though.

Read full topic

item.title: PostScript Viewer [C++/OpenGL]
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

[quote=“terrankiller, post:12, topic:141959”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=194319.msg1752540#msg1752540 date=1189653482]

Very interesting. 64 bit eh? Damn. I plan on taking a c++ course spring semester, I’ll take a look at it.

The code will compile on anything, I just have a 64-bit linux distro and therefore compiled a 64-bit linux executable. The windows executable is 32-bit.

I’m too poor to afford a computer thats not windows ;(.

That doesn’t really make sense, linux is free?
[/quote]

I have a $400 dell computer lol… I don’t believe I can install a Linux OS.[/quote]If your computer can run windows, there is no way it can’t run Linux, unless it’s totally retarded.

Read full topic

item.description:
@system wrote:

I ran it under my 32-bit env and my PC imploded and generated some kind of supernatural singularity. It's now destroying our town, killing our women, and raping our men. What do you suggest? :'(

works fine for me under winxp sp2

Read full topic

item.title: PostScript Viewer [C++/OpenGL]
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It just doesn’t make sense to write a C++ (or any, for that matter) application in a platform dependent way if it can be averted by simple things such as using a cross-platform library and using correct capitalization. Compile once, run anywhere does avoid the 32/64bit windows/linux/mac/bsd compilations you have to do with C++, but its not really that bad (or at least it won’t be once I get mingw compiling properly)

Once I figure out all the quirks of c++ as compared to java I should be able to write much better programs, it is sufficiently different to have a short learning curve

Read full topic

item.title: PostScript Viewer [C++/OpenGL]
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Not bad… FOR A NUB! =)

I ran it under my 32-bit env and my PC imploded and generated some kind of supernatural singularity. It’s now destroying our town, killing our women, and raping our men. What do you suggest? :’(

But I luv platform independence in C++ as well. Probably because so many ppl think C++ is platform dependent, as they always bring that up when speaking about how much better java is in comparison. It’s true you only have to compile java once, but come on…

Read full topic

item.title: PostScript Viewer [C++/OpenGL]
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Only losers use platform specific libraries

When they aren’t doing something platform specific that is, like you can use windows libraries if you are editing the windows registry.

edit:

[quote="#moparscape"]* seand (~seand@kl.detector) has joined #moparscape
suck my penis mopar
Only losers use platform specific libraries Wink
l2highlight
learn to shut the fuck up
touchy, eh?
he pisses me off
“Note this is real C++, not some bastardized windows version.”
whatever

  • seand has quit (Quit: )
    Note: seand == capndurk[/quote]

Haha, I have never laughed so hard
He must be mad at either the fact that this is real code, or that I didn’t supply a pre-built windows binary. ;D
